intro: Crantzia multiflora, commonly known as the many-flowered crantzia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. It produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Crantzia multiflora is often found in well-drained soils and is adapted to dry, temperate climates.
